results.description: Chelsea record a sixth consecutive Premier League win for the first time since their most recent title-winning season in 2017.
results.shortTitle: Chelsea record sixth straight win
results.title: Chelsea 2-0 Crystal Palace: Frank Lampard's side record sixth straight win

thumbnail.altText: Christian Pulisic celebrates scoring Chelsea's second goal

results.description: Crystal Palace manager Roy Hodgson says he is "proud" of his side's performance despite 2-0 defeat to Chelsea.
results.shortTitle: Hodgson 'proud' of Crystal Palace performance
results.title: Roy Hodgson 'proud' of Crystal Palace's performance after Chelsea loss

results.description: Head coach Frank Lampard says Chelsea "deserved" the 2-0 win against Crystal Palace after picking it up in the second half.
results.shortTitle: Chelsea 'deserved' win - Lampard
results.title: Chelsea 2-0 Crystal Palace: Frank Lampard says Chelsea 'deserved' win after a strong second half

results.description: Leicester move up to third in the Premier League as second-half goals from Caglar Soyuncu and Jamie Vardy see off Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.
results.shortTitle: Leicester go third with win at Palace
results.title: Crystal Palace 0-2 Leicester: Caglar Soyuncu and Jamie Vardy score as Foxes go third

results.description: Roy Hodgson admits Crystal Palace are not blessed with a plethora of strikers and have to "work hard" for goal-scoring chances following the 2-0 loss at home to Leicester City.
results.shortTitle: Eagles not blessed with a plethora of goal scorers - Hodgson
results.title: Crystal Palace 0-2 Leicester: Palace have to work hard for chances - Hodgson

results.description: Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers says he has "great pride" for his team after securing a "fantastic" three points in the 2-0 victory at Crystal Palace.
results.shortTitle: Rodgers proud of 'hungry' Leicester players
results.title: Crystal Palace 0-2 Leicester City: Rodgers proud of 'hungry' players

results.description: Arsenal surrender a two-goal lead and captain Granit Xhaka was booed off the pitch as Unai Emery's side were held by Crystal Palace at Emirates Stadium.

results.title: Arsenal 2-2 Crystal Palace: Gunners surrender two-goal advantage as Granit Xhaka booed off

results.description: Arsenal boss Unai Emery says Granit Xhaka's behaviour was "wrong" after the captain was involved in an angry confrontation with the home fans during their 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace.
results.shortTitle: Xhaka was wrong - Emery
results.title: Arsenal 2-2 Crystal Palace: Xhaka was wrong - Emery

results.description: Crystal Palace boss Roy Hodgson his side did a "fantastic job" as they came from two goals down to earn a point at Arsenal.

results.title: Arsenal 2-2 Crystal Palace: Hodgson pleased with 'fantastic' display

results.description: Crystal Palace manager Roy Hodgson says he's "proud" of the "spirited" performance shown by his players, as the Eagles lost 2-0 at home to Champions Man City.
